Description: A scene of judgement, study for the upper image of Plate 36 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; the French general Desaix judging a young male Egyptian thief who places his hat at the feet of the Frenchman Pen and black ink, grey wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Jacques Joseph Coiny for Denon's 'Voyage...' (there is no copy of the book the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12). The drawing depicts General Desaix's judgement of a beautiful twelve-year old Egyptian who had been caught thieving from the French army. The boy took off his hat and put it at the general's feet with the words: 'here is my head, cut it off'. He was pardoned. Lit.: P. Rosenberg (ed.), exhib. cat., Paris, Musée du Louvre, 'Dominique-Vivant Denon: l'oeil de Napoléon', 1999, no. 98
Exhibition history: 1999/2000 Oct-Jan, Paris, Musée du Louvre, Denon 1747-1825 2000 Mar-June, Rome, Museo Napoleonico, Bonaparte in Egitto
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Representation of: Louis Charles Antoine Desaix
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
